item.description:
Please join Boston Volunteers and members of the Braintree Area Community as we gather to help start Habitat for Humanity's Braintree Area Local Partnership Committee (LPC)!  We have built 4 homes in Braintree and are organizing a Local Partnership Committee (LPC) in anticipation of another Braintree or local build in the Braintree area.

 

We will spend some time at tonight's Community Meeting discussing various aspects of the LPC, including but not limited to Fundraising, Outreach, Faith Relations, Land/Site Search and more.  We have several fundraising initiatives underway and are seeking a Secretary for our LPC.  After our Community Meeting we may break out into Committee Meetings (primarily Outreach/Communications, Fundraising, Faith Relations and Land/Site Search).  Please join us to meet your Leadership Team, Committee Members and Neighbors at our monthly Community Meeting!

 

This is an exciting opportunity for those who want some hands-on experience with Habitat for Humanity, even if not actually lifting a hammer to physically build a home for a family. The Local Partnership Committee (LPC) participates in lots of behind the scenes activities and brings the community together. This is a great way to utilize your skills, meet neighbors, help spread the word about Habitat for Humanity work together to bring a local family into homeownership.

 

Please join us as we learn more about Habitat for Humanity and each other.

 

Please RSVP Yes only if you are at least 98% sure you will be attending.  If you are unable to attend but want to learn more and/or be added to the email list please email your contact information (name, email, town) to the email address listed below.  Please be advised there is no need to RSVP No if you are unable to attend. (Our apologies for the late posting of this event.)


The Boston Volunteers

Big enough to Deliver, small enough to care

Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org

Follow us: @BostonVolunteer

 

http://www.facebook.com/BostonVolunteers

or Do you have Twitter?

https://twitter.com/#!/BostonVolunteer

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

Habitat for Humanity Braintree Area LPC Community Meeting!

Wednesday, December 12th @ 7pm-8:30pm

Braintree Community Youth Center

74 Pond Street, 2nd Floor

Braintree, MA 02184

W: www.sshabitat.org

E: BraintreeLPC@sshabitat.org

 

Meeting Location: BCYC, located on the 2nd floor

Event Host(s)/Organizer(s): Angela and the SSHH BALPC Leadership Team

Min/Max: All are welcome!  Since the room capacity is 60 people we will set the maximum for this group at 20 people.

Guests: Welcome, please keep it to one per person.

Fees/Costs: None, unless we go out for a bite to eat afterwards.  Please bring cash to pay for your food and beverages if so.  The BCYC offers drinks for sale for $1 each which goes towards the BCYC.

RSVP Deadline: Wednesday, December 12th @ 5pm

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Directions to the Braintree Community Youth Center (BCYC) located @ 74 Pond Street, Braintree, MA:

 

Overview: The BCYC is located on Pond Street, approximately 1 mile from Braintree High School and the T and highway. It is one of two brick buildings next to a cemetary across from Sunset Lake.


From Routes 24/95/128/93:
Head towards Route 3 South/Braintree/Cape Cod.

 

From Route 3: Take Exit 17/Union Street, Braintree.  Exit the Rotary heading towards the T and South Braintree.  Go straight through the 1st light keeping the T on your left.  Go up the hill and take a left at the next light onto Washington Street.  Follow straight thru 2 sets of lights passing Town Hall on your right.  At the next set of lights take a right, which is still Washington Street.  (Rite-Aid is at this intersection.  It will be to your left at the light and behind you after you make the turn.)  Take a left at the next light (onto Route 37S) keeping Braintree Cooperative Bank on your left.  Take a right at the next light onto Pond Street.  74 Pond Street is 1/4 mile up on the left next to a cemetery.  It is one of two brick buildings.  Park on the side.


From the Braintree T: Follow directions above on foot.
item.how_to_find_us: We meet in the BCYC located on the 2nd floor.

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Habitat for Humanity Braintree Area LPC December Community Meeting!
